p: We now include the potential for fully efficious vaccination ( u 1) in the optimal control of dengue infections in a single settlement. Specific values for the daily cost of a vaccination programme are difficult to define precisely, however, Carrasco et al. [ 29] estimates the annual cost of control methods at $50,000,000 (≈ $136,990 d −1). We begin with the most idealized version of the vaccine, one which instantly moves susceptible hosts to the fully recovered class R ( ξ = 1), and which is fully effective, and able to be administered to the entire population. We fix the other costs, C 1 = 510 and C 3 = 400, and present our optimal solutions for varying vaccination costs ( C 2) in figure 4.
